abstract: Five people were named to a committee intended to protect the editorial independence of the Wall Street Journal when it becomes part of News Corporation.
snippet: Five people were named to a committee intended to protect the editorial independence of the Wall Street Journal when it becomes part of News Corporation.
lead_paragraph: Five people just signed on for what may be the most thankless task in journalism: making sure that Rupert Murdoch plays fair with his new acquisition, The Wall Street Journal.

headline.main: Murdoch and Dow Jones Pick 5 to Safeguard Wall St. Journal
headline.print_headline: Murdoch and Dow Jones Pick 5 To Safeguard Wall St. Journal

abstract: Did the last-minute side deal for News Corporation to pay the Bancroft family’s advisers’ fees influence the advice the family received?
snippet: Did the last-minute side deal for News Corporation to pay the Bancroft family’s advisers’ fees influence the advice the family received?
lead_paragraph: On Sunday night, after months of debate within the Bancroft family about protecting the editorial independence of Dow Jones & Company, the discussion turned to a very different, 11th-hour, question: would Rupert Murdoch’s News Corporation cover the Bancrofts’ legal and banker fees?

headline.main: The Side Deal in the Deal for Dow Jones
headline.print_headline: The Side Deal In the Deal For Dow Jones

byline.original: By Andrew Ross Sorkin and Richard Pérez-Peña

abstract: Stocks staged their second consecutive late-afternoon rally today, recovering even more losses from the sharp sell-off last week.
snippet: Stocks staged their second consecutive late-afternoon rally today, recovering even more losses from the sharp sell-off last week.
lead_paragraph: Stocks staged their second consecutive late-afternoon rally today, recovering even more losses from the sharp sell-off last week.

abstract: The Dow Jones industrial average closed up 150.38 on Wednesday after a late rally, with technology stocks among the biggest gainers.
snippet: The Dow Jones industrial average closed up 150.38 on Wednesday after a late rally, with technology stocks among the biggest gainers.
lead_paragraph: They bobbed and weaved. Then, seemingly out of nowhere, they surged.

headline.main: A Last-Minute Rally Saves the Day, if Not the Week
headline.print_headline: A Last-Minute Rally Saves the Day, if Not the Week

byline.original: By Jeremy W. Peters and Wayne Arnold

abstract: Just in case Rupert Murdoch is wondering who watches CNBC – the business network that he plans to compete with this fall when he introduces a competitor, the Fox Business Network – a series of commercials starting Thursday will tell him.
lead_paragraph: Just in case Rupert Murdoch is wondering who watches CNBC – the business network that he plans to compete with this fall when he introduces a competitor, the Fox Business Network – a series of commercials starting Thursday will tell him.

headline.main: As Dow Jones Is Sold, CNBC Launches New Ads

abstract: A new report from Dow Jones VentureOne reveals that venture firms in the United States have raised less capital during the first half of 2007 than in any other six-month period in almost four years.
lead_paragraph: A new report from Dow Jones VentureOne reveals that venture firms in the United States have raised less capital during the first half of 2007 than in any other six-month period in almost four years.

abstract: Many say the outcome of Rupert Murdoch’s $5 billion move on Dow Jones & Company was inevitable. But some unusual side transactions along the way to this week’s agreement are raising questions about how the Bancroft family, which controls the company through a special class of shares, was persuaded to support the deal.
lead_paragraph: Many say the outcome of Rupert Murdoch’s $5 billion move on Dow Jones & Company was inevitable. But some unusual side transactions along the way to this week’s agreement are raising questions about how the Bancroft family, which controls the company through a special class of shares, was persuaded to support the deal.

headline.main: The Side Deal in the Deal for Dow Jones
